Key Match Events: Roston Chase played an ice-cool 42 off 27 deliveries to cap off his stunning first innings catch and rescue West Indies' topsy-turvy run-chase.
Sese Bau notched up a valiant fifty for Papua New Guinea.
Andre Russell and Alzarri Joseph were the most successful bowlers for West Indies with a couple of wickets each.
West Indies won by 5 wickets against Papua New Guinea in the opening Group C match of the 2024 ICC T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell, the victorious skipper of West Indies, appreciated PNG for the way they played and mentioned the importance of starting well.
Assad Vala, the captain of Papua New Guinea, said that it was a competitive score but they missed a trick towards the end and were 10-15 runs short.
Roston Chase, the PLAYER OF THE MATCH, expressed his pleasure in starting the tournament with a win and mentioned the hard work he put in for the event.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Papua New Guinea posted a well below-par total on the board.
West Indies restricted PNG to a meagre total.
Papua New Guinea's spinners were exceptional in the middle overs giving nothing away to the batters and picked up crucial wickets.
West Indies suffered an early blow losing Johnson Charles quite early.
Papua New Guinea's ground fielding was a bit sloppy, and they gave away a few boundaries that proved to be really costly for them in the end.
